GJMeRHsnW1G2E_KfcM5q9g.text: I ordered the French toast with home fries that come with peppers and onions. It was DELICIOUS. The staff was awesome and the environment is chill and laid back. Great place for food with friends.

lcgg60Ds7NTT-HeufDRRbw.text: Great place and great food. Orders the jerk chicken salad sandwich, Mac and cheese along with an apple berry smoothie. Not disappointed with any of it. Would def go back and try some more!

mZq4Biz6KlQsOjupn6L2Cw.text: Closest thing to a home cooked meal  for breakfast..  freshly squeezed oj and delicious omelet

GQd8YXJmr55zH_fVyyJ7lg.text: Very nice place.   Great food  and friendly staff.    I had the pimento steak sandwich and it was amazing.    What else is there to say.

IcbkbqtqxFQIXd51RTRlAg.text: The service this morning was nice and inviting. Christy served us with kindness and patience. This is my new favorite for coffee and breakfast

kej6t1KXrHa4iiYxABeOXA.text: The have the most awesome Cuban sandwich around. Very nice add to the west side. Good luck.

orF8bUhSUrSKJ5krWMkoEw.text: This is a really cool place.  I love that they promote and make local small business apart of their space. The staff is very friendly and helpful to first timers who are trying to get the full experience.  The food is amazing and this will be on my list of frequents as we move into spring. Smoothies all summer long.. so excited

M_ccCTZZjH2bRQhbw-gUhQ.text: Veggie Hummus sandwich is Amazing!!! Definitely looking forward to trying one of their all natural smoothies and the Shrimp salad sandwich next on my list.

6TnfH5wdbJqzBccf8rUYTg.text: This is the kind of place we should all eat at. Folks who care about the quality of your food and beverages as well as care about supporting the local community. As more and more "chain restaurants" appear on the horizon, there are always places to eat, but are those the places you WANT to eat at? Not always. I was in town on business and once again Yelp gave me my dinner spot - this time it was Toucan Louies. What an amazing Mediterranean salad!!  The dressing is tasty and loaded with dill. It was luscious. The veggie hummus sandwich was a taste treat as well. I ate here 2 out of my 3 nights in town, and I'm making this my "GoTo" food stop whenever I'm back in Charlotte. C'mon west side - support this place - you'll be glad you did!!!  The coffee is awesome too!!!

S31UTarKfYXrhBW0XNy_wQ.text: Great little find this weekend. They use mostly locally sourced products and make as much in house as they can, including roasting their own coffee.

DoHkL3wuC3tka5GyZuPDhg.text: Really enjoyed the food and atmosphere. I had the pimento cheese steak sandwich with home fries. The price was was great considering the portion size. I was also very impressed with the pimento cheese. It was clearly freshly made. Overall an excellent meal at a good price. Plan to go back for breakfast sometime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States

2Pld235y3_bNSjAE1sVbXQ.text: Had lunch here today - great place and I love the ideas and menu.  Perfect place for the neighborhood.

-C2DDOSyJX84BFu5AAj2vw.text: We are so excited to have Toucan Louie's in the neighborhood!! I'm currently sitting on my couch drinking their breakfast blend coffee and it's excellent! We have tried their espresso drinks and breakfast and lunch sandwiches as well. Definitely get the one with goat cheese or their homemade pimento cheese. Their toasted roll is SO good. My only constructive criticism is that both their almond milk and coconut milk lattes were not good. The coconut milk latte was overwhelmingly coconut-y and greasy. The almond milk latte tasted off and like it was a day or two old. But this was also during soft opening so I'm willing to retry!

900vqyM0nL6pC1dLrs9_8A.text: Great little breakfast and sandwich joint. Very nice and the pimento and egg BLT was very good.

esTBWB4tG6PHhYwwPYfhKw.text: First time was amazing. Friendly staff with great menu. I chose the 3 French toast breakfast with fruit and it was amazing. The Carmel latte was very satisfying . I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a great environment and great food.

PVEg9yiK09eeuWHEQ2m9Xw.text: Great food and friendly staff!!!  The pimento and egg sandwich for breakfast is yummy and the pimento cheese steak for lunch is yummy!!

Q3ElBDdXnIzHP2fBA1F5Cw.text: Excellent service. Knowledgeable, friendly, and kind staff. Fresh, local ingredients. We will definitely be back very soon!

sjHUV-LWUhJWdPuhICREkw.text: Wow! What a great little spot.  I stumbled onto this place while on a morning bike ride.  What a True hidden gem!  Best of luck to you all.

wBFdBzBDGNHsK-_uOpT-1Q.text: Sandwiches are amazing! Such a great addition to west Charlotte. Pimento and chimichurri sandwiches are delicious. Very great price and can't wait to try their breakfast sandwich next.

kNZ-O_LzvOIm5sbwxp3TeQ.text: What a gem to find. Was passing through and found them via my phone. Everyone that worked there seemed happy to be there and super friendly.  Homemade goods. Quick in and out, bright and airy vibe. I don't live nearby, but I will be back! Bonus: super close to Blue Blaze Brewery and even deliver there :)

oHBI9WX8PSKJW1fRCZqDMg.text: Great for lunch!  Cuban was Delish! The staff was great and welcoming. A little off the beaten path but I love places like this.  I will definitely come back to try some of the other options they have for sandwiches.

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great 1st visit.  I had the Cuban and it was great!  Next time I look forward to trying the Pimento Steak Cheese

zjCvq-HJkKWVPeFsmrcchw.text: Super cute local shop with really good bites and a nice shopping selection to boot. Food is really fresh and well-portioned. I got the pimento cheese steak and my boyfriend the ham, egg, & cheese on bagel. I really liked the cheese steak! Nicely toasted french bread with real roast, similar to a French dip. The pimento really makes it! But it's not too heavy either. My boyfriend really liked his bagel sandwich as well, and said the bagel was especially good -- not too doughy nor chewy. What I thought really makes this place shine is their little marketplace, where you can shop a nice little selection of local honey, coffee, tea, soda, and other knickknacks. They also have really cool chips, like yuca chips and plantain chips. Also great coffee and lattes! I got the dirty chai latte and liked the spice so much I bought the tea mix. Service is very nice and prompt. Also, they have a really good  emphasis on environmentally friendly practices -- compost, recycling, etc. Finally, they have a 15% discount on different days of the week for college employees, bank employees, etc... I thought that was a nice touch to celebrate local workers. I'm glad Toucan Louie's is expanding to a second location! Would like to return during a future visit to Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Local soda in interesting flavors!
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious! Pimento cheese steak and dirty chai latte. Ham, egg, &amp; cheese bagel in the background.
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cute tea names for the tea they serve by a local tea place. &#34;Finnegan&#39;s Wake Up&#34; is my favorite for an Irish Breakfast tea...

oxIxlOTd88Tt71BDUy0-mA.text: Great place in West Charlotte on Rozzelles Ferry Rd (down the road from Johnson C. Smith Univ). Great coffee place...they roast their own beans in house. Great sandwiches and snacks...including a juice bar with a bunch of delicious options. They carry all local/NC products...from eggs to popcorn to milk. They pride themselves on being sustainable with their products, down to the straws and cups! Highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States

egXOsbbDLiecFO0Ux_daPw.text: Had to give a shout out to the owner, Mark, who hand delivered an order to Blue Blaze Brewery yesterday during their new beer launch! Had a delicious pimento cheesesteak sandwich and kettle chips (jalepeno and queso!).   They technically don't deliver but I'll keep coming back here for the great food and the amazing customer service!

Mc_zLbawZdxPx6ruZ2DKcg.text: It's fresh, local, and tastes wonderful. The service is excellent - friendly, helpful staff and the food comes out quickly. I had the Funky Chicken Sandwich special (grilled chicken, bacon, cheddar, and their special BBQ sauce) and loved it. My wife had a veggie hummus wrap and said it was delicious. (I'll trust her on that, veggies aren't my thing.) A great place for lunch or dinner. We'll definitely be eating here again.

F4ocagS58ghRreQyFVCtEA.text: Perfect for the way I am eating. Love their Congee with sweet potato, coconut and pistachios. Their selections are mostly NC local, homemade granola, freshly roasted coffee with grass fed milk.

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pre-made to go and fresh. Love the Congee made of millet, fab fresh-roasted coffee with grass fed milk.

R68oVTecOfoAGX87H-CFLg.text: Awesome!!  I had the jerk chicken salad sandwich!!  With cucumber salad, jicama slaw and fruit cup!  All were amazing. I will be back!

Hwjc4i6fd-TyUbGoTUxq4w.text: This is a little out if the way spot with delicious sandwiches and house roasted coffee! The best lattes my wife and I have had in years, rich and creamy!

uEQhjNqJGxyKGPz01Q7NKA.text: Great place! Visited here before a flight out of Charlotte airport, good options for kids and adults alike. Had the coconut smoothie; goat cheese, red pepper, spinach and egg breakfast sandwich (breakfast served all day), kids had 3 cheese grilled cheese, salads with bacon, all very yummy. Love the eco friendly touches, compost etc. Bathrooms handicap accessible and spacious, clean. Really friendly and accommodating staff.

fN1zT6Bxwi-_UFcp9WKQ7A.text: The jerk salad was good raisins and pistachio nuts which I wasn't expecting. The Mac was dub par. Needs seasoning. It's the pimento cheese mixed with noodles. Super greasy I had to put a paper napkin in the corner to catch the grease. Peach tea was good. About 11$

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Greasy Mac

QA0siwrk50lCEVUxf0slyw.text: The sandwiches were fresh and delicious and made to order. Stay away with it accommodates some of my special request and that is always a nice thing!

sgdTOvkGjr6YvQTYeO3bog.text: Really convenient little market making some delicious smoothies and sandwiches friendly staff and awesome service!

5e2m6FeybS0etIFZUWpUig.text: Delicious! Simple and easy ingredients! Staff is a pleasure and the store is great :) good up the appeal and good food!

vuSJ9FMNgXLMiJ2OfpM_gw.text: Don't be fooled by the coffee and sandwich description.  This place makes legitimate from scratch food from locally sourced ingredients. On the weekend they have a full menu of breakfast items including french toast, benedict, beakfast meats, etc.  We had the Cuban sandwich and the jerk chicken salad sandwich which were tasty and fresh for lunch.  A few days later had the Gouda, egg, and avocado sandwich and the egg/meat/home fries for breakfast which was outstanding. I highly recommend this place.

TGR-HLVjVtTFuq3Yjx44Rw.text: Stopped in for lunch and had a great sandwich with excellent service. I will be back for sure next time in town. I love the concept and menu. I wish I had a place like this back home.

4ZfATeFYrTMgS132-Ii_Ng.text: Went on are weekly adventure with my aunt and found Themis place on our travels. Good and fresh will be back

mtKv6xojREvz_HVZgXKaCw.text: While visiting Charlotte,  we tried Toucan Louie's for breakfast at 8:45 on a Sunday morning. I was a little nervous when I saw an empty parking lot upon arrival.  Nevertheless was we entered what is clearly an old filling station repurposed as a small cafe.   The staff was friendly and inviting.  The bacon,  egg and cheese biscuit was yummy with the biscuit being quite buttery and flaky.   My daughter enjoyed the blueberry pancakes and bacon.  A real find!   Thank you for a wonderful breakfast.

Tb6MlJufm1x4WqWA_7z_nw.text: I'm really excited for this place! The Westside has been in need of a good market/deli/coffee place and this place is all of that! My fiance brought me on a Sunday morning and we ordered breakfast food, but the deli area is open all day long and serves a variety of sandwiches too. Parking is minimal, but there is a dirt lot out back that we parked in and didn't have any issues.  I ordered the Twisted Goat breakfast sandwich, which is spinach, egg, roasted red peppers, mushrooms and goat cheese on a roll. If you like goat cheese, you will like this sandwich. The cheese is very creamy (local!) and blends well with the other breakfast flavors. They had also just started offering a combo deal that included their homefries and a coffee. The homefries were also great! They were big chunks of potato roasted with peppers and onions, like a cheesesteak :)  I will definitely be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coffee roaster

d4FROL2D_XR7aYUGe_LXTA.text: Cute little spot in West Charlotte. Stopped in on a Sunday morning to grab coffee and ended up getting lunch as well. The employees were very friendly and accommodating. The place wasn't busy at all so we were served quickly. We ordered a bacon egg and cheese sandwich, pimento cheese sandwich, Toucan Fogger, and a vanilla iced coffee. I loved my pimento cheese sandwich. I asked for it melted, it was delicious. The tomato and lettuce were fresh. The bread wasn't over toasted. The BEC sandwich was good but could have been made better of the bacon was crispy, my husband ended up taking all of it off because it was just fat. The toucan fogger smoothie is good and I liked the ice coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Love their sign
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento egg sandwich with home fries

E11jhz6G4wNZA2jaet3kbQ.text: Wow! If I could give it more than 5 stars, I would without hesitation. I completely agree with everything Nikki stated in her review. It was not busy at all when I went today (prob from holiday still) and thoroughly enjoyed talking with Marc, the owner. Such a humble man with amazing products...literally everything is local and he is not bragging about it. Its just a matter of fact that this is what he is about, so cool. Coffee roasted there and peanut butter...so good! Marc roasts all of the coffee himself and he loves doing it. How can you not want to support this establishment? Such good vibes. Excellent breakfast sandwich, compliments to the nice chef. I am already obsessed with it and have mapped it out for my commute to and from work...oh and the prices are so affordable. Latte and egg cheese bacon (crispy and was actually crispy and perfectly to my liking) for less than $8. I am a huge fan and with me living 8 mins away on the west side, I am excited to see this business grow as the West takes off with new growth. A small, local business win!!

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States

eV_Sd76N-cs9rqBW_h3xZg.text: Very delicious and fresh food. Nice clean and open space. A hidden gem in the West End. Go check it out. Breakfast burrito was solid; my fiancee enjoyed her shrimp and grits.

8W1BQGNssVioCOUrZiMWbA.text: Toucan Louie's is the type of place that the West End needed, and frankly I'd like to see more of around Charlotte. Market places with deli counters that get food and atmosphere right become hangouts - and I'm so glad we're within 10 minutes of this place. It's located a bit north of Five Points, and my only gripe about the location is the lack of parking (6 parking spaces total, although there is a gravel lot out back... not sure if it was okay to park there, but that definitely didn't stop us, nor did we get towed haha)...  Walking in, you're met with a super bright interior and a good number of tables. The market area is lined with coolers and shelves of local products, mostly NC, some even donate to charities like the chips! The menu is extensive and features ALL local made products. Everything from the meats, to the cheeses, to breads, to pickles, to the people sitting there reading the paper. It's all local. I ordered the That's Gouda breakfast sandwich which had ham, avocado (side note, I'm not able to say that word without thinking about the video of the little boy opening his Christmas present), gouda, and some other yummies. We were upsold to a combo (new!) which included coffee and homefries. The meal was affordable, filling, and most of all absolutely delicious. The homefries had peppers and were seasoned beautifully, it was just great.   Because of the market aspect and the rest of the menu that I've still yet to try, I absolutely cannot wait to return!

y2VFhG7og6cM6lOjCydcxQ.text: First experience is extremely positive. I live in the neighborhood and is a great feeling to have neat places pop up close by.   First impression - this is a shack. Boy was i wrong. Out came delicious smoothies, exquisite lattes, fresh pressed peanut butter, pimiento cheese spread, hummus, and more. The owner and family was there assisting the employees tackle orders and requests. Live music was on stage. Outdoor area was kid and dog friendly. What more can you ask for?

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Decorations and for sale items.
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Entrance to store.
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Parking lot and store side.

uHbOG-QMqPBDvl-2VQoa-g.text: Delicious spot for any meal with tons of homemade recipes including breakfast served all day, weekday entree specials, and a great lunch menu. A hidden gem for sure!

HD7y8BX-ebOzEAdaHOMFYg.text: Okay.  I'm excited because I just found this great neighborhood place to eat. I had the Cuban sandwich which was fantastic with a side of Mac-n-cheese. The really cool thing is they serve breakfast all day ( my kind of place). I would recommend you try it out when you're in the neighborhood. If you're not in the neighborhood, make the trip over.  P.s. Good job on that sandwich guys !

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States

kgbYBq-5a0ZSoen3zFBM1w.text: I was looking for some place for a late lunch with hubby before dropping him off at the airport. Let me tell you it was well worth the detour! This looks like a former gas station. It's very nicely decorated place. Everything was delicious. I had the Cuban and it was outstanding, thinly sliced pork and ham. Hubby had a cheeseburger that came out on a nice Kaiser roll that was toasted. I also had a side of mac and cheese. It was hot and creamy, just needed a little more salt and pepper otherwise it was really good. A great variety of drink choices. They also have beer and wine. They have a nice breakfast menu that we are going to try too! We didn't have dessert but boy did that strawberry cake look so good! We'll be back for sure!

nXYf4qxm6D3GNHW6NHmnDQ.text: This little hidden gem is just on the outside of uptown. It's an up and coming area and deserves some recognition for its great food. The staff is warm and kid friendly and the kids meals are just as yummy as the regular dishes. The menu is a mix of all American and southern dishes for breakfast and lunch. There's breakfast all day as well as beer and wine and some local faves. The coffee and tea selection is also great so there's something for everyone. I'll definitely be back!

SpB1n8fKsmIeQk6SEGhGEg.text: Everything I have had here has been absolutely delicious!   The Spinach Sweet Potato salad tastes phenomenal and is the perfect balance of ingredients; you can tell the spinach is fresh & clean, the small diced sweet potato bites are prepared perfectly, bacon is always a welcomed addition to anything I have on my plate, the candied pecans add a touch of sweetness, and the goat cheese adds just enough creaminess and moisture that I didn't even need to use the balsamic vinaigrette that the lovely worker recommended. If you really feel like taking it to the next level order 8oz of the Shrimp Salad for only $4.95. Completely worth it!   If you're in the mood for a healthy pick me up, give the Greendrink 12oz juice a try! They make it right in front of you so you can see all the whole fruits and veggies going into your drink. And despite the green appearance that might make you question your order, it is very tasty and then you can skip your workout that day! ;)   While i was there they also offered me a handful of samples which was wonderful, so I also tried the Freekah (quinoa medley), cucumber salad, and pimento cheese!! All were delicious of course! I can't wait to go back again to try every single breakfast items, all the burgers, and anything with pimento cheese on it!   Also, the staff was super friendly with great recommendations!! The women at the register had gorgeous natural red hair. And the nice woman in the kitchen was very quick!

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. The &#34;Greendrink&#34; 12 oz Fresh Juice: apple, celery, cucumber, ginger, lemon, lime, parsley, spinach, romaine, kale.  DELICIOUS!!!
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu!
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu!

JWXt8Gxp23OshzBVwvZm1A.text: Driving through Charlotte and stoped here to eat. I loved the vibe and ascetic. The prices seemed very reasonable and the food was very good. I would definitely stop back in if I were to find myself in Charlotte again!

w5AnCc5nGfnury5RiOnuGA.text: Wow! What a cute little spot. So many NC snacks, beers, and coffee. I had the barbecue Cuban sandwich and tried the That's Gouda. The Cuban has a delicious sweet slaw with pineapple, yum. The Gouda was delicious as well. The buns are fresh and soft.  The owner greeted us when we came in and explained all of the fantastic, sustainable practices and in-house roasted coffees.  The patio is cozy but does not, currently, have shade.  Seriously awesome place with great prices.

TQ_WlXZ58vLXR-H2JiR_Fw.text: Three words: All Day Breakfast. Came here New Year's Day with my family and family friends at 1:00 pm craving breakfast sandwiches. Yes, you read correctly, 1:00 pm. The Twisted Goat was hands down the table favorite, and I always appreciate free refills on coffee.

KCEn_V9T2IXKnNSPvYHCtA.text: Love this place! So environmentally friendly and so kind. Great food and coffee. Save the Earth one step at a time!!!!!! Wohoo

nSlL2V13xt5g_Sy4tmkEuA.text: Hidden gem! Looking for a great sandwich shop, with a nice atmosphere, super friendly staff and that is exceptionally clean and tidy? Toucan Louie's is a place you'll want to visit? The owners definitely take pride in their business and it shows.   I enjoyed a huge club sandwich with crispy bacon, Mac & cheese and loved the sweet peach tea. My wife enjoyed the Cuban, home fries and sweet tea. The bread for their sandwiches is super fresh.   We're looking forward to being back soon.

dUCND7OhHWH85qDgXU6Wbw.text: I had the pleasure of attending a Yelp Elite event where Toucan's catered our lunch. I was very impressed with all of the proper presentation and wrapping of each item in our reusable bag. The attention to detail is something I appreciate being the the meeting coordination industry. The sandwich was absolutely delicious and fresh. You can completely tell they roast their turkey breast onsite and it was not dry. The bread they used was also very good which is a big component to the sandwich as well. The fruit with lavender syrup was such a nice touch. I have a lot of corporate catered events for work and plan on reaching out for assistance in the future.

2TvzCeBIm4FzdkZI55TOOg.text: I'm a local to Florida, so coming to a new town can be overwhelming with all the different restaurants. I found this gem close to our Airbnb and we were blown away by how nice the staff were and quick the food came out. We all got different food items: French Toast, Breakfast Sandwich, Pimento Cheesesteak!! It was all phenomenal, especially the teas and coffee. I would highly recommend it and come back next time I'm in town.

omKBs1oLzNEEkXwJbBu-JQ.text: Food poisoning city!! STAY AWAY for you own good! My boyfriend and I had breakfast here this morning ( he had a sausage egg and cheese wrap and I had a chimichurri sandwich) within 3 hours we are both vomiting our brains out. The location is also in a unsafe area of town, under no circumstance should you go once it's dark out. The staff was friendly but that's about the only positive thing I will ever say about this place.

vwsHMx3lTfPBc_tRlrnGTQ.text: We were looking for a quick place on our way to the airport and I was so glad we stoped in. We ordered bacon egg and cheeses on bagels, pimento egg on a roll, and a dark roast coffee everything was exceptional.  All their main ingredients are NC sourced which we loved. There's a cute area with games, crayons, and coloring books to keep kids occupied while your waiting for your food. Great food, great experience. It makes a difference when places seem they care about your experience, waste, and local ingredients.

s-FSQ1EBysZiF_ulXarv5w.text: This was my second time having Toucan Louie's. The first time I had it during a catered lunch for work. I really enjoyed my sandwich and was excited to try it again.   I went on a Tuesday around 1/130pm. The front parking lot is small so it was full but there is parking in the back. It wasn't busy but most of the tables were occupied. It's spacious but there aren't a lot of tables.   I ordered the jerk chicken salad sandwich with mac and cheese. I'm not sure what was going on but it took a really long time (20+ minutes) to get my food. The wait felt even longer because I was starving when I arrived. It took so long that person who took my order came over to me and said that it was taking too long and offered me cake for free.   So what about the food? Well, the cheesecake was REALLY good. My sandwich was good but not as good as the first sandwich I had. The mac and cheese was not good. I would never recommend that anyone order it unless they like boxed mac and cheese with no seasoning.   The customer service was great though.   Would I go back again? I'm not sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheesecake
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac and cheese
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jerk chicken salad sandwich

HKjmM_jMB-7lpQIYt-DxGQ.text: So let me get the positive experience out of the way. The Cafe Latte wasn't bad! Coming Miami we've yet to find good coffee in Charlotte. They have their own parking area which is nice. The shop looks clean and seating is well spaced.   And that's about the only positive experience we had, because the food was subpar as were the portions.   I ordered a breakfast biscuit sandwich and I'm not exaggerating when I tell you it was a ONE bite size sandwich. The biscuit was hard and the bacon wasn't crispy and freshly cooked. It was the smallest sandwich I've ever seen!   I would definitely not return or recommend.

Yf4id6OtvuMIrgtzAWJQcA.text: I really enjoyed my experience at Toucan Louie's. It was my first time going. I went with a few coworkers for lunch. It was definitely a cafe type set up. Seems like a good place to study, work, or just enjoy the atmosphere. They have board games that are available to play. There are items available to purchase outside of the food menu such as wine, jarred honey, and more.   The food there was really good. I got the Friday special which consist of salmon cakes. I got the salmon cakes, side salad and fresh fruit. I really enjoyed my meal. My coworkers got sandwiches which I will try next time as they look really appealing and filling (a lot of bang for your buck).  The staff were really nice and so was the service no was unsure of what I wanted or about some the options on the menu so the staff was very helpful with my questions. I ordered and she brought everything out to myself and coworkers.   I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Side of fresh fruit
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Game night info
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon cakes and side salad with fresh fruit

ZKAk01jtDPZUmSDyWdLscg.text: Absolutely yes! I was looking up sandwiches when I was driving through the area and this is such a special little gem. The Cuban sandwich was fantastic and they sell cakes from a local bakery. I had a slice of the strawberry cake. I will definitely be back for the steak sammich and another slice of cake!

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cuban
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Strawberry cake

b_AliyIy39lSyZcMhrfcYg.text: Went here for a late Sunday lunch. It wasn't busy and we were able to thoroughly look over the menu and enjoy the place. I love the atmosphere, similar to rhino and common market. They have a variety of sandwiches and I love that they have coffee and cappuccinos. We ordered one of the turkey sandwiches and a peanut butter banana sandwich. Both were so yummy! Can't wait to come back and try the coffee

L20s2tVbLWAs0KdKz5GwzA.text: Nikki turned a bus full of knuckleheads on to this place and I'm finally checked in, check out her review for some appropriate gushing and fun facts. For me it was kind of an adventure getting here but that's okay... meandering down to CLT to pickup MLB after work and Michael just blew past messing up air traffic on the way. So I gots some time. Funky Chicken plus cucumber salad and a mysterious medium coffee. Sandwich is pretty impressive in all it's locally sourced chickeny goodness. Check the parts list, it's got all that working together in the best of ways but the sauce's bright earthiness makes it all swimmy. Wasn't sure about dill with the cucumbers, it's just not how I'm use to (yet?) gives it an almost perfumey taste, maybe some carraway for balance? Regardless, it is full of cucumbery deliciousness! Yea fresh coffee...  Yea little patio...

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thursday Special: Chicken plus collards and rice
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Funky Chicken, cucumber salad, brand new fresh coffee coffee, and my flatware :-)
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. really, try one...

VoyMAjqlDgy3bsQMN9Etmg.text: I am absolutely obsessed with everything about this place.   Located on the westside just off 77 (you can get there in 5-10 minutes from uptown pending where you are), Toucan Louie's is a hidden gem in a converted old gas station.  All of their products are from North Carolina based vendors. Seriously, even the Midas Spring water (it's bottled in Huntersville!). They roast their own turkey, pork and beef in house (all North Carolina raised meats). The burgers are grass fed, the cheese are from NC cheesemakers. The coffee is roasted in house. So many things made in house: granola, peanut butter, pimento cheese.  They provided lunch for one of my Yelp events. Several people said the turkey club was the best sandwich they've ever had. I love the Shrimp salad (I get it on a wrap instead of the roll). The shrimp is steamed in citrus juice. Their Cuban BBQ features a homemade Cuban BBQ sauce that has over 20 ingredients.   Breakfast, lunch, coffee, smoothies, juices- they do a little bit of it all. And I love it! Everyone who works here is so nice, including Owner Marc. Such a good guy.    Note: their parking lot is kind of small, so you may need to park in the overflow lot next door (there's a sign to point you in the right direction).

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Peanut butter and banana
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp salad (I get a wrap instead of the bread)

Nzd8W6Qdofem-C0q4p6xYA.text: WOW!!!!!! This place is where it is at and if you have not tried them yet stop whatever you are doing and head over there now! They are tucked away over on the west side just off of 77 and right now there is a lot of construction so your favorite mapping ap might take you a interesting way.  I love how almost all of their products are local to NC. They also use paper/ plastic products that can either be recycled or composted. They roast their own coffee and the deli meat is processed in house.  I am slightly obsessed with their shrimp salad sandwich! First off it is HUGE and has so much meat in it you actually can not fit it in your mouth and it has to be eaten with a spoon. It is not all about size as it's taste is also amazing with just the right amount of dill and mayo. Trust me once you try it you will be back for it again and again.   I have now been there a few times and everything I have gotten and my friends have had was been spot on. This is a great new place for breakfast or lunch in the Queen City.

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp salad sandwich

z3GA8hNQkISU9SrIm2Z0Rw.text: First timer here! I didn't know what to get. I saw pictures of the shrimp salad sandwich and thought I would get that but then went with the turkey hummus goat cheese sandwich on wheat bread. And I'm so happy I did! I loved that turkey (roasted in house)! This sandwich was fresh, crispy and large!   The side of freekeh salad was light and refreshing. I would love a giant scoop on this on a bed of spinach!  They make a ton of items in house too; pimento cheese, salad dressings, peanut butter and many more.  There is cute patio on the side and dog friendly. There are a handful of tables inside and would be a great stop if you need to get some work done or want a quieter lunch.  It makes my heart happy to see to many NC based food items; popcorn, chips, water, local meats, etc. I'll be back for the shrimp salad and jerk chicken salad!

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Freekeh salad
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey hummus goat cheese sandwich

v95vSWwMBpCDniipfvPSbQ.text: I cannot believe this place is 1.4 miles from my house, yet I only recently visited. Man was I missing out.   Things I love about this place:   -Friendly staff, I mean FRIENDLY. So nice, everyone that I've deal with while in there.  -Compostable plates, cups, etc.  -Unique and varied, yet not overwhelming menu.  -SHRIMP SALAD. In the month since my first visit here, I've been back 5 times and each time I've gotten a tub to go (and each time I eat it in the same day).   It's got a very nice feel too it, not too cozy but lots of space and seating. I've only gone early to mid morning so not sure how busy it would be at lunch time.   Pro-tip: on the weekends they do a broader breakfast menu featuring some of the best chocolate chip pancakes I have ever had!   Love this place!

N4GauRUIqq5CJkYn9ISjiQ.text: Yum! I've been here several times and have always had great service and excellent meals! I stick with the shrimp salad but get it in a wrap. It is full of tasty and well prepared shrimp. Seriously, so yummy! I know they have tons of other options but I don't see myself ever NOT ordering this. My husband has tried the philly and the pimento cheese (add bacon) and loves both (although he admits that the prefers the pimento + bacon because of the abundance of crispy bacon). All in all - a great spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento Cheese Sandwich + bacon
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Salad in a wrap

8ajVs4nmJ4Eb6SEH7_50SA.text: I really like this place! I discovered Toucan Louie's when they provided lunch  for a Yelp event. I was so impressed with the presentation (and taste, of course) that I just had to check it out. They were even kind enough to provide alternative items for my lunch (aside from everyone else's) due to food allergies. Also,at the event we were informed that this place pretty much tries to use all fresh/locally-made products and that many of the items they prepare with can be purchased at the restaurant.  I visited on a late Sunday afternoon so there were a few people in/out. The guy taking orders was very polite and service was quick. I ordered a turkey sandwich with hummus and goat cheese. The best way I can describe both sandwiches that I have had from them is wholesome, as in filling and delicious. The bread that I had both times is the perfect combo of toasted, but soft. The bread also has an addictive buttery taste (the bread was a strong factor in my visit. Yes, that good and i like bread).The Turkey was perfectly tender and the hummus, so full of flavor. I purchased a tub to-go.  When I used it to make a sandwich the next day, it really gives the kick that I didn't realize was missing (eh, lunch was getting boring). Honestly, I like it more than any hummus I have ever tasted.   Anyway, I am looking forward to trying out some more stuff from here in the very near future and often. I found the layout of the restaurant to be adorable. It is small, but think cozy/quaint instead of cramped. They have  really done well in maximizing the space. There is table seating as well as bar stools facing the window. There was  also some table-top/card games available. This place gives me the feel of simpler times... It definitely has a little something for everyone's taste buds.

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey, hummus, goat cheese on wheat
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento burg &amp; 3-cheese mac
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States

fBGGbMTBWiAnaSm_kBuhww.text: This is the cutest shop ever! I thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere, customer service, as well as food. The funky chicken was delicious as well as the house potatoes. My friend ordered a classic burger and mac and cheese. His food was good with the exception of the mac and cheese. It was like Kraft . I will definitely return.

5w6CKZEMDOWA4GNaAzSpJQ.text: BACON!!!!  A wonderful place to grab lunch to go or for delivery at Blue Blaze.  Tried on a bus trip and was blown away from the turkey bacon awesomeness.  The Bread was wonderful, the meat was tasty and the bacon was the best.  I was shocked to find that everything is sourced locally - even bottled water (too much?).  The meat is all roasted at their old converted gas station - including the BACON!!!  The turkey club I ate required me to remove the middle piece of bread - it was just too much bread that took away from the meat, but the turkey and bacon blew me away!    After learning about them from Yelp! We ordered some sandwiches while relaxing at Blue Blaze and was not disappointed.  The PB was wonderful and smooth, and the roast beef was lean but tender.  I am looking forward to trying a burger the next time I venture to Blue Blaze since they are so close.

Kq5TqQlWG56Y1tN5rukbzw.text: I really wanted to LOVE this place, but I only LIKE it.  Here is the scoop.... I first visited this place not terribly long after it opened.  The coffee was great, the food was all messed up though.  I ordered a pimento sandwich and they literally didn't put the items on it as indicated on their menu, they only put pimento cheese.  I didn't complain, I just ate it with the mindset that they were new.    My next experience was the same.  I ordered scrambled eggs with cheese, and they literally just placed a slice of cheese on top of the already scrambled eggs.  Presentation is everything, well along with taste of course, and it had neither of those things.  The french toast was okay, after being drowned in what I was told to be maple syrup.  Jury is still out on that one.    They have a few random and sparsely stocked shelves of local items which feel out of place.  They should really rethink the floor plan, especially the shelves.  It has a gas station vibe instead of a cafe.   Long story short, they have enormous potential to really make this great, but it all starts in the kitchen.  I'm keeping my fingers crossed they can listen to feedback and really make this place a hot spot in the community with lines out of the door.

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States

S0wLCEDwM4xADX8jxbjlMA.text: After reading the reviews for this restaurant we had very high hopes for it. I was surprised people said the staff was so friendly because I did not get that vibe at all. We were barely spoken to and instead of asking if we had been in before, the woman at the register just stood there waiting for us to order...no recommendations or questions for us to help.   I ordered the pimento burger and it was just ok, not even top 10 burgers I've had. I didn't care for the bun they put it on. There was not much to say about the side of Mac and cheese, except that it wasn't anything I couldn't get at any other restaurant...not much to it.   My mom ordered the pimento cheese steak and she liked it but it was $7.95 and didn't come with a side. (She even asked if a side was extra to be sure and the girl said yes)   My nephew ordered the home fries with mac and cheese (which he is a conniseur of) and he barely touched the mac. The home fries were great!  My 2 year old got the pbj and ate all of it, but who can't make that at home? Lol  I might come back to try something for breakfast and update. Hopefully they work on their customer service and taste. I really want to like this place, it's so cute and a neat add to the community.

5XqJ6pVyBnLfk4Sk-WcTHw.text: I had this place bookmarked for a while. I was able to go in with ease on a quiet Saturday afternoon. The lady behind the counter was very helpful. She explained the menu to me and also let me sample a few things. I finally decided on the shrimp salad sandwich and the 3 cheese mac and cheese. I also purchased a container of jerk chicken salad to save for later. I am not a soda drinker and not big on sweet tea at all. But she let me taste their peach green tea...HONEY!!!!!! It was delicious! And they have the good ice!!!!! They sell it in 10lb bags too.   I was able to meet and talk to the owner Marc, and his manager who runs the place BB. Both were very nice and pleasant. I shall return to check this place out some more!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States

lkKoHjG46ZXobLQLCFPTvg.text: Convenient location - easy to get in and out with overflow parking and didn't have to pay for parking (a pet peeve of mine). We visited on a Saturday early AM and had no wait. Staff was very friendly and glad to answer questions about their menu. All of their containers, cups, etc are compostable so that's really cool, too. Prices were fair, but to be honest the food was a little underwhelming - my husband wasn't a fan of his pancakes at all and said they had a weird taste & texture.

XFjoTbt63SPKCO7knYwwcg.text: Grand opening today at TL! Soft opening happened last month in December. Met the owners wife today, so friendly and about this neighborhood! (LOVE) located here in west end in Biddleville! Happy to see more cool lil places starting to pop up around here.   Toucan Louie's named after their dog, Louie.   So today for grand opening they gave away some coffee beans, whoop whoop! And some samples. I tried: their in house pilmento cheese SO GOOD. In house peanut butter which is also good. Hummus, granola, jams, and honey. I recommend their strawberry lavender honey which they sell from a local vender (all jams that is).   Decent selection of canned beer here in their coolers. Otherwise you can find all natural juices (decently priced for 12 oz $4.95-$6.95), coffee, burgers and sandwiches.   Cafe & Roastery  Good vibes here. Boardgames. Friendly/inviting atmosphere. Reminds me of a smaller rhino market.

photos.caption: Photo of Toucan Louie's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu! Affordable. Especially the juices...all natural. 12oz range from $4.95-6.95!
